metadata.title: CVE-2018-0495 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Libgcrypt before 1.7.10 and 1.8.x before 1.8.3 allows a memory-cacheside-channel attack on ECDSA signatures that can be mitigated through theuse of blinding during the signing process in the _gcry_ecc_ecdsa_signfunction in cipher/ecc-ecdsa.c, aka the Return Of the Hidden Number Problemor ROHNP. To discover an ECDSA key, the attacker needs access to either thelocal machine or a different virtual machine on the same physical host.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-0495` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgcrypt20 - 1.8.1-4ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

libssl1.1 - 1.1.0g-2ubuntu4.1
openssl - 1.1.0g-2ubuntu4.1
No subscription required

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.2n-1ubuntu5.1
openssl1.0 - 1.0.2n-1ubuntu5.1
No subscription required

libnss3 - 2:3.35-2ubuntu2.1
libnss3-tools - 2:3.35-2ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libgcrypt20 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.1-4ubuntu1.1').
openssl package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.0g-2ubuntu4.1').
openssl1.0 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.2n-1ubuntu5.1').
nss package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.35-2ubuntu2.1').
